wikipedia_page.main: Lena Halliday (1872 – 19 December 1937) was an English stage and film actress.She as born Selina Heinekey in Balham, London, UK and died in Battersea, London, UK.

response: | Adam's Apple || rowspan="13" | Silent film || rowspan="3" | Comedy || Tim Whelan || Monty Banks, Lena Halliday, Judy Kelly

Adam's Apple is a 1928 British silent comedy film directed by Tim Whelan and starring Monty Banks, Lena Halliday and Judy Kelly. It was made by British International Pictures at their Elstree Studios.Wood p.65

Premiering at the Palace Theatre, Manchester it transferred to the West End for a 152 performances at the Saville Theatre which lasted between 28 March and 19 August 1933. The original London cast included Bobby Howes, Wylie Watson, Abraham Sofaer, Judy Gunn, Lena Halliday and Marie Burke.Wearing p.277
